This is a fine musical with a timeless score by one of my favorite composers (Gershwin) and a nice 'Parisien' atmosphere which gives the Bostonians the inspiration to sing and dance their way to happiness. Marisa Monte gives life to the haughty Parisienne Golde, as well as two legendary Romances on "The Man I Love" with or without the help of the other couples; I swear you can taste every note of delicious Gershwin music

A woman who hates cats (Alice Krige) and her son (Brian Krause) have moved into a small town, and must deal with a mean cat. The cat, Simon, is being chased by the neighbor Simon (Michael Sharlet), who wants to kill the cat and sell it to his friend, who is an animal collector.
